svcprocinfo.para: The front bumper swing arm safety gate is available in two variations: powered electro-magnetic arm lock, and non-electromagnetic arm lock. The electro-magnetic arm lock is located on the drivers side of bumper assembly (Item 1, Figure 21).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Front Bumper, Safety Gate Components

step1.para: Release hood latches on each side of hood and tilt hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Disconnect the base assembly power unit plug (Item 3, Figure 26) from the magnet harness tee connector (Item 2). If the safety gate is not equipped with electromagnetic gate lock unplug the safety gate power plug (Item 3) from the chassis pig-tail plug (Item 1, Figure 26).
Swing safety gate to open position.
Remove four 1/4-20, by x 1/2" long bolts and 1/4-20 SS nylok (Items 4 and 5, Figure 23). Remove safety gate from upper and lower swing arms.

To remove base assembly / power unit (Item 3, Figure 22), remove four 1/4-20 x 3/4" long HXHD SS bolts and four 1/4-20 WHZ HXHD SS nyloks (Items 3 and 5, Figure 23). Remove base assembly / power unit.
To remove electromagnetic gate lock (if equipped) unplug magnet harness tee connector (Item 2, Figure 26) from chassis pig tail (Item 1) located behind bumper passenger side.
Unplug electromagnetic power plug (Item 4, Figure 26)from magnet harness tee connector (Item 2).
Remove 1/4-20 HXHD SS bolt and 1/4-20 SS nylok from bumper (Item 8, Figure 25) at driver side of front bumper assembly to remove electromagnetic power unit and mounting bracket.

svcsubproc.title: Safety Gate - Install
svcsubproc.para: Installation of safety gate requires inspection of items to be installed. The safety gate is available in two variations. Version one includes the electro-magnetic gate latch. The second version does not include the magnetic gate latch.

step1.para: Release the hood latches on each side of vehicle and tilt hood at 45 degree angle. Begin the installation procedure on the passenger side of the vehicle.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 23 for the following Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Insert four 1/4-20 x 3/4" long SS HXHD bolts (Item 3) in the respective holes on passenger side of bumper assembly. Install the 1/8" spacers (Item 10) on the 1/4-20 x 3/4" SS HXHD bolts.

Place and align the base assembly power unit (Item 9) behind the bumper assembly on the previously installed bolts. Rotate the upper and lower gate brackets through the slots in the bumper. Install the 1/4-20 WHZ HXHD SS nuts (Item 5) and tighten.
Align the mounting holes in the upper and lower swing arms with the holes in the safety gate mounting bracket.
Insert the 1/4-20, B.H. x 1/2" long bolts (Item 6) through the safety arm mounting bracket and the upper and lower swing arm brackets. Install the 1/4-20 WHZ SS HXHD nuts (Item 5) and tighten.
Prior to installing the polycarbonate cover to the power unit, feed the power unit cable through the cover slot.
Place the polycarbonate power unit cover over the four studs at rear of the power unit assembly. Install the four 1/4-20 SS HXHD nylok nuts and tighten.
If the installed unit does not require the electro-magnetic gate lock, plug the power unit into the chassis pigtail.
If the unit requires the electro-magnetic gate lock, proceed to the drivers side of the bumper assembly.

Locate the mounting hole in the top of the bumper and insert a 1/4-20 x 3/4" SS HXHD (Item 8) through the bumper and align with hole in the electro-magnetic power unit mounting bracket (Item 5) 1/4-20 SS HXHD nylok and tighten.
Check alignment of safety gate latch plate (Item 7, Figure 25). Latch plate must mate squarely with the magnet.
Plug magnet harness pig tail (Item 4) into the magnet harness tee connector (Item 2).
Plug safety gate power unit (Item 3, Figure 26) into the magnet harness connector tee (Item 2).
Check operation, and torque all bolts and nuts. (Refer to the Torque Chart.)
Lower hood and secure hood latches.
